meanings.definition: To hold (the eye, attention, etc.) firmly.
meanings.sent1: The magician riveted the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent2: I was riveted by the thrilling plot of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The puppy riveted my attention by doing backflips.
meanings.sent4: Her words riveted me to the spot, unable to move.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful painting riveted me, capturing my gaze for hours.

meanings.sent1: The sturdy metal bridge was riveted together for strength.
meanings.sent2: The riveted metal armor protected the knight in battle.
meanings.sent3: The riveted seams on the jeans gave them a cool, industrial look.
meanings.sent4: Her riveted gaze showed determination and focus.
meanings.sent5: The riveted door held firm against the strong wind, not budging an inch.

meanings.definition: A metal pin for passing through holes in two or more plates or pieces to hold them together.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker used a rivet to join the metal beams.
meanings.sent2: The airplane's wings were secured with rivets for safety.
meanings.sent3: The shiny rivet rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: She collected colorful rivets to use in her art projects.
meanings.sent5: The old ship creaked as the rivets loosened, causing concern among the crew.
